## What is Pandas?

Python library for data manipulation and analysis.

## Core Data Structures

| Structure | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Series | 1D labeled array |
| DataFrame | 2D labeled table |

## Why Pandas?

- Easy data loading
- Powerful manipulation
- Handles missing data
- Great for exploration

> ğŸ’¡ Pandas is essential for data work!

slides.title: Basic Operations
slides.content:
# Basic Operations ğŸ”§

## Loading Data

```python_not
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv('data.csv')
df.head()
df.info()
df.describe()
```

## Selection

| Method | Use |
|--------|-----|
| df['col'] | Single column |
| df[['a','b']] | Multiple columns |
| df.loc[] | Label-based |
| df.iloc[] | Index-based |

> ğŸ¯ Use loc/iloc for precise selection!

slides.title: Data Manipulation
slides.content:
# Data Manipulation ğŸ“Š

## Common Operations

```python_not
# Filter
df[df['age'] > 30]

# Group
df.groupby('category').sum()

# Merge
pd.merge(df1, df2, on='key')

# Pivot
df.pivot_table(values='sales', index='month')
```

## Method Chaining

```python_not
result = (df
    .query('age > 30')
    .groupby('city')
    .agg({'salary': 'mean'})
    .sort_values('salary'))
```
